alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHEASTERN SWITZERLAND, NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, BOONE, WESTERN GALLATIN AND CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Rising Sun, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, North College Hill, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Mount Healthy, Bellevue and Fort Wright. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 7. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 7 and 19. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 174 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
